original_definition: 'best efficiency point' means the range hood operating point with maximum fluid dynamic efficiency (FDEhood);
generated_definition: 'best efficiency point' means the electric power input of a domestic range hood at its most efficient point, calculated by a specific formula and rounded to the first decimal place.
